definition: Strauss (name)/Johann Strauss (1825-1899), Austrian composer/Richard Strauss (1864-1949), German composer
to grant/to give/to bestow/to act/to carry out
special/unique/distinguished/especially/unusual/very/abbr. for 特克斯[te4 ke4 si1], tex
to toil/labor/laborer/to put sb to trouble (of doing sth)/meritorious deed/to console (Taiwan pr. [lao4] for this sense)
Slovakia/Slovak/abbr. for 斯洛伐克[Si1 luo4 fa2 ke4]

sentences.english: Structural linguistics gave rise to Levi-Strauss's structural anthropology.
sentences.chinese: 结构语言学催生了施特劳斯的结构人类学。

sentences.english: How many waltzes did John Strauss the younger write?
sentences.chinese: 小约翰施特劳斯写了多少首华尔兹曲？

sentences.english: Johann Strauss the younger wrote more than 400 waltzes, ?
sentences.chinese: 小施特劳斯写了400多首圆舞曲，是吗？

sentences.english: Harnoncourt is a passionate believer17 in Strauss.
sentences.chinese: 哈农考特是施特劳斯的狂热崇拜者。

sentences.english: Remember we had that even with the Strauss.
sentences.chinese: 记得我们在听施特劳斯的时候也有这样过。

definition: Handel (name)/George Frideric Handel (1685-1759), German-born Baroque composer, naturalized British in 1727
Hector Berlioz (1803-1869), French romantic composer, author of Symphonie Fantastique
Antonin Dvořák (1841-1904), Bohemian composer, author of nine symphonies including the New World symphony
Modest Mussorgsky (1839-1881), Russian composer, composer of Pictures at an Exhibition
Haydn (name)/Franz Joseph Haydn (1732-1809), Austrian classical composer
Piotr Ilyich Tchaikowsky (1840-1893), Russian composer, composer of 6 symphonies and the opera Eugene Onegin
